    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Perform all one-time initialization of the OpenGL state. Typical examples include enabling or disabling features, allocating reusable textures and buffers, and compiling shader programs.

      • resize

        public abstract void resize(int width,
                            int height)
        Make any adjustments needed to accommodate a change in the window size. Typical examples include reallocating textures to match the new window size, resetting the viewport matrix to match the new window size, and adjusting camera aspect ratios to match the new window aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        width - New window width in pixels
        height - New window height in pixels

      • draw

        public abstract void draw()
        Draw the window contents into the default framebuffer, making no assumptions about the current framebuffer contents.

      • keyEvent

        public void keyEvent(int key,
                     int scancode,
                     int action,
                     int mods)
        Handle a keyboard event. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses, but provides a default behavior of exiting when the ESC key is pressed.

        The constants are defined in org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW. The underlying API is documented here.

        Parameters:
        key - An integer indicating which key was pressed, in a system-independent way. Key codes are documented here.
        scancode - A system-dependent integer indicating more precisely which key was pressed, useful for getting input from nonstandard keys.
        action - One of the values GLFW_PRESS, GLFW_RELEASE, or GLFW_REPEAT
        mods - A bit-mask of the values GLFW_MOD_SHIFT, GLFW_MOD_CONTROL, GLFW_MOD_ALT, and/or GLFW_MOD_SUPER, indicating which of these modifiers was down at the time of the event. On MacOS keyboards, Option is reported as ALT, and Command is reported as SUPER. On Windows keyboards, the Windows key is reported as SUPER.

      • mouseButtonEvent

        public void mouseButtonEvent(int button,
                             int action,
                             int mods)
        Handle a mouse button event. Button events only describe what happened with the button; if you need to know where the mouse cursor was at the time, you need to keep track of the information coming from mouse motion events.

        The underlying API is documented here.

        Parameters:
        button - Which button, generally GLFW_MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT or ..._RIGHT.
        action - Which way the transition was, GLFW_PRESS or GLFW_RELEASE
        mods - A bit-mask of modifier keys; same as keyEvent.

      • mouseMotionEvent

        public void mouseMotionEvent(double xpos,
                             double ypos)
        Handle a mouse motion event. Motion events are generated rapidly whenever the mouse cursor is changing position.

        The underlying API is documented here.

        Parameters:
        xpos - The horizontal position, measured in screen coordinates relative to the left edge of the window content area.
        ypos - The vertical position, measured in screen coordinates relative to the top edge of the window content area.

      • scrollEvent

        public void scrollEvent(double xoffset,
                        double yoffset)
        Handle a scroll event. Scroll events are generated by mouse wheels, trackpad gestures, and some other input devices.

        The underlying API is documented here.

        Parameters:
        xoffset - The horizontal scroll offset.
        yoffset - The vertical scroll offset.

      • run

        public void run()
        The main entry point. Call this method on a new instance to start the app. This method does not return until the app exits.
